classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License
info.description:
# AndroidStringsFileConverter

![VERSION](https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/android-strings-file-converter) ![PYTHON_VERSIONS](https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/android-strings-file-converter) ![STATUS](https://img.shields.io/pypi/status/android-strings-file-converter)

A simple python tool to convert android `strings.xml` file to `xlsx` and vice versa.

**Features**
- Supports `string-array`
- It will ignore `translatable = "false"` string.

## Setup

```
pip install android-strings-file-converter
```

## Usage

```
android-strings-file-converter <action> -i <Input file> -o <Output file name>

positional arguments:
action                  xml-to-xlsx (Converts xml to xlsx)
                        xlsx-to-xml (Converts xlsx to xml)             

optional arguments:
  -i, --input           (Required) Input file
  -o, --output          (Required) Output file name
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -v, --version         show program's version number and exit
```

## Examples

1. To convert `strings.xml` file to `xlsx`

```
android-strings-file-converter xml-to-xlsx -i strings.xml -o translations.xlsx
```

2. To convert `xlsx` file to `strings.xml`

```
android-strings-file-converter xlsx-to-xml -i translations.xlsx -o strings.xml
```

## File structure sample

**[strings.xml](https://github.com/ar-arvind/AndroidStringsFileConverter/blob/master/strings.xml)**

```XML
<?xml version = "1.0" encoding = "utf-8"?>
<resources>
	<string name="app_name">Android Sample App</string>
	<string-array name="theme_list">
		<item>Light</item>
		<item>Dark</item>
	</string-array>
</resources>
```

**[translations.xlsx](https://github.com/ar-arvind/AndroidStringsFileConverter/blob/master/translations.xlsx)**

key | value
--- | -----
app_name | Android Sample App
theme_list | [Light,Dark]

info.html_description:
AndroidStringsFileConverter

A simple python tool to convert android strings.xml file to xlsx and vice versa.

Features

  • Supports string-array
  • It will ignore translatable = "false" string.

Setup

pip install android-strings-file-converter

Usage

android-strings-file-converter <action> -i <Input file> -o <Output file name>

positional arguments:
action                  xml-to-xlsx (Converts xml to xlsx)
                        xlsx-to-xml (Converts xlsx to xml)             

optional arguments:
  -i, --input           (Required) Input file
  -o, --output          (Required) Output file name
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -v, --version         show program's version number and exit

Examples

  1. To convert strings.xml file to xlsx
android-strings-file-converter xml-to-xlsx -i strings.xml -o translations.xlsx
  1. To convert xlsx file to strings.xml
android-strings-file-converter xlsx-to-xml -i translations.xlsx -o strings.xml

File structure sample

strings.xml

<?xml version = "1.0" encoding = "utf-8"?>
<resources>
	<string name="app_name">Android Sample App</string>
	<string-array name="theme_list">
		<item>Light</item>
		<item>Dark</item>
	</string-array>
</resources>

translations.xlsx

key value
app_name Android Sample App
theme_list [Light,Dark]
